intro: Manettia paucinervis, commonly known as the slender manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves with few veins. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a tubular corolla. Manettia paucinervis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
